fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e1.equipments.indoorgarden

Class IndoorGarden

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e1.equipments.indoorgarden.IndoorGarden
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, IndoorGardenImplementationI

    public class IndoorGarden
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
implements IndoorGardenImplementationI
    The class IndoorGarden implements the distant control unit of a small indoor garden which turns a light on during the day to help growing the crops.

    Description

    This component is provided to show a kind of electric equipment that can both be planned and suspended. However, the plan here is a bit different from plans in other equipments like washing machines where a plan can be postponed but then it will still be fully completed at a later time. The indoor garden can postpone the beginning of its plan, but then the plan will be shortened as the end of the plan will remain the same. Also, the plan is meant to ne repeated each day, another difference from a plan for a washing machine.

    The indoor garden is implemented in such a way that when switched on, the light is off. Switching the light on and off is done automatically through the plan defining the time at which it must be switched on and the time at which it must be switched off. Hence, the light will not be operative until a plan is defined.

    As the indoor garden needs an access to the current real time to operate properly, a simulated mode if provided that allows to set the current time arbitrarily.

    Invariant

     invariant       true        // TODO

    Created on : 2022-09-14

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • currentlyActive

        public boolean currentlyActive(java.time.Instant timeOn,
                               java.time.Instant timeOff)
        return true if the current time is between timeOn and timeOff.

        As the component works with LocalTime, times are on a 24H/day. Hence, if timeOff comes after timeOn, then the current time must really be in between. If timeOn comes after timeOff, then we assume that the lighting begins on one day and ends on the next day. Thus, in this latter case, the current time must be either after timeOn or before timeOff.

        Contract

         pre     timeOn != null
 pre     timeOff != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        timeOn - beginning of the lighting.
        timeOff - end of the lighting.
        Returns:
        true if the current time is between timeOn and timeOff.
